item.title: 2020#55 Readings of the Week
item.description: I have been on holidays, which has resulted in a lot of reading, mostly books.

item.title: Haskset: Deckset presentations in reveal.js
item.description: After my happy experience with Haskell rewriting the ticketiser from Python to Haskell, I moved next on my list of rewrites.

item.description: This one is actually making it on time. Don’t get used to it.

item.description: This is a project recap on writing some non-super-trivial Haskell for the first time.

item.title: 2020#51 Readings of the Week
item.description: I should remove the Weekly moniker of these posts and emails. They are done when they are done. Enjoy!

item.title: Review of Finding Success (and Failure) in Haskell
item.description:
Ever tried.
Ever failed.
No matter.
Try again.
Fail again.
Fail better.

item.title: 2019#32-33 Readings of the Week
item.description: Yeah, I skipped last week. On Saturday Python Barcelona organised PyDay 2019, and I was one of the organisers aside from giving a workshop on PySpark, so I felt pretty tired on Sunday. Of course this means this is a double issue.

item.title: 2019#31 Readings of the Week
item.description: This week there is a lot of functional programming (mostly Scala, a bit of Haskell) and data engineering topics. Of course, there is also the usual random stuff I find interesting as well (and other engineering topics).

item.title: 2019#30 Readings of the Week
item.description: A mixed bag of interesting history tidbits sprinkled with Haskell code, Scala stuff, data engineering systems and practices, and how to code with your voice.

item.title: 2019#29 Readings of the Week
item.description: This feels like a heavy engineering edition. A lot of Haskell, Rust, Python and Scala. Thereâ€™s still a bit of everything, but this will appeal hardcore developers more than usual.

item.title: 2019#27 Readings of the Week
item.description: Some data engineering, a bit of Haskell, programming music, Python and random bits and bobs. I recommend you play with the third. Several good books this week, as I have ramped up my reading: current goal would be 52 this year.

item.title: 2019#20,21,22 Readings of the week
item.description:
I have been pretty busy lately, and although reading doesnâ€™t stop, my writing sometimes takes a hiatus.

Data engineering, adtech, history, apple. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the tag here . You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.

item.title: 2019#19 Readings of the week
item.description: History, haskell, Wardley mapping, functional programming. Expect a similar wide range in the future as well. You can check all my weekly readings by checking the tag here. You can also get these as a weekly newsletter by subscribing here.
